thread.title: REPORT: Yemen Raid Has Not Yet Yielded ‘Significant’ Intelligence
thread.title_full: REPORT: Yemen Raid Has Not Yet Yielded ‘Significant’ Intelligence

author: Josh Feldman
title: REPORT: Yemen Raid Has Not Yet Yielded ‘Significant’ Intelligence
text:
REPORT: Yemen Raid Has Not Yet Yielded ‘Significant’ Intelligence by Josh Feldman | 7:26   
There is a report tonight that the recent U.S. raid in Yemen that resulted in the deaths of civilians and Navy SEAL Ryan Owens has “so far yielded no significant intelligence.” 
Per NBC News : 
Although Pentagon officials have said the raid produced “actionable intelligence,” senior officials who spoke to NBC News said they were unaware of any… 
A senior Congressional official briefed on the matter said the Trump administration has yet to explain what prompted the rare use of American ground troops in Yemen, but he said he was not aware of any new threat from al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, the al Qaeda affiliate that was targeted. 
A few weeks ago, there was an issue when the Pentagon touted a video as valuable intel that turned out to be several years old . The Department of Defense said today that the raid did yield a “significant amount” of intelligence. 
Controversy over the raid has continued into this week with recent remarks made by Owens’ father criticizing the “stupid” mission and saying he did not want to meet with President Trump . Sean Spicer responded today , “I can tell him that on behalf of the president, his son died a hero.” 
[ image via screengrab ]
